intro: Agathophora postii, commonly known as the Hawaiian moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces large, showy white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators like moths. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments. Agathophora postii is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species.
